quest.name: Pest Control
journal: Hervoix is loath to start his new assignments.

Hervoix has been worrying over the list of tasks given to him by O'bhen Tia, unsure of which one to procrastinate on doing first. Eventually he decides to take care of the beasts that have been stalking the forest to the east. Or rather, he decides to have you take care of them. Head to the eastern camp and speak with Guenaret for any information regarding your targets' whereabouts.

After speaking to Guenaret about the oversized arachnids, you learn that O'bhen Tia himself demanded that Guenaret wait until someone was sent to settle the problem. Although you were not actually the one meant to do the job, Guenaret seems eager to be rid of the menace. Go north and search for any signs of the beasts, which are said to resemble giant spiders.
The monsters will no longer pose a danger to the forest's chocobos or hunters. Report your success to Hervoix at Tailfeather to receive your reward, hopefully this time in a timely manner.

You relay the story of your errand to Hervoix, and he seems to be slighted by the fact that O'bhen Tia would dare entrust him with such dangerous work. With his chief's intentions still a mystery, he gives you your reward and begrudgingly returns to his list of tasks.
objectives: Slay the monsters near the Hissing Cobbles.

dialogue.name: HERVOIX
dialogue.text: I suppose I should at least look at the chief's requests... Which job should I do...

dialogue.name: HERVOIX
dialogue.text: “Some unseemly beasts have been sighted near the camp to the east. Slay them before any chocobos, or chocobo hunters, come to harm.”

dialogue.name: HERVOIX
dialogue.text: Godsdammit, he means to make me slaughter more mindless brutes? How're we supposed to make a living if we're not out hunting? Say...this type of job might befit a certain adventurer I know...

dialogue.name: HERVOIX
dialogue.text: How does a jaunt into the forest for some monster killing sound? Of course, more gil awaits you upon completion.

dialogue.name: HERVOIX
dialogue.text: Splendid! As you likely already know, a hunter's camp lies to the east of here. Ask Guenaret for any information about the beasts terrorizing the chocobos.

dialogue.name: HERVOIX
dialogue.text: The camp is just to the east of here. Ask Guenaret what he knows of these alleged beasts.

dialogue.name: GUENARET
dialogue.text: You're here lookin' for those maddenin' beasts too? Ain't never seen a thing like them in these woods. Seems they're lurkin' about to the north of here.

dialogue.name: GUENARET
dialogue.text: I had a mind to take care of them myself, but O'bhen Tia was awful insistent that I stay put, said he'd be sendin' someone over to do it. I reckon that's you? Well, as long as it gets done one way or the other, I suppose I've no right to complain.

dialogue.name: GUENARET
dialogue.text: Ain't never seen the likes of those beasts in this forest before. Head north if you're planning on lookin' for them.

dialogue.name: HERVOIX
dialogue.text: Ah, you're back quicker than I expected. Now, tell me all about your exciting hunt!

dialogue.name: HERVOIX
dialogue.text: D-Diremites, you say!? Thank heavens for you, adventurer, as I have a terrible phobia of anything with more than four legs. But, if what Guenaret said was true...

dialogue.name: HERVOIX
dialogue.text: Why would the chief put such dangerous work on my shoulders? I could've been injured, or worse...

dialogue.name: HERVOIX
dialogue.text: Hmmm, I suppose it's best not to dwell on such matters for now. Once again, you have proven your excellence at killing. Your reward is well deserved!
